description:
BrowserSync includes a user-interface that is accessed via a separate port.
The UI allows to controls all devices, push sync updates and much more.
name: ui

description:
BrowserSync can watch your files as you work. Changes you make will either
be injected into the page (CSS & images) or will cause all browsers to do
a full-page refresh. See [anymatch](https://github.com/es128/anymatch) for more information on glob patterns.
name: files

description:
File watching options that get passed along to [Chokidar](https://github.com/paulmillr/chokidar).
Check their docs for available options
name: watchOptions

description: Use the built-in static server for basic HTML/JS/CSS websites.
name: server

description: Proxy an EXISTING vhost. BrowserSync will wrap your vhost with a proxy URL to view your site.
name: proxy
port
snippet:
// Use a specific port (instead of the one auto-detected by BrowserSync)
port: 8080

description:
Enable https for localhost development. **Note** - this is not needed for proxy
option as it will be inferred from your target url.
name: https

description: Clicks, Scrolls & Form inputs on any device will be mirrored to all others.
name: ghostMode

description: Can be either "info", "debug", "warn", or "silent"
name: logLevel

description:
Change the console logging prefix. Useful if you're creating your
own project based on BrowserSync
name: logPrefix
logConnections
logFileChanges

description: Log the snippet to the console when you're in snippet mode (no proxy/server)
name: logSnippet
snippet:
// Don't ever log the snippet
logSnippet: false

description:
SINCE 1.7.0! You can control how the snippet is injected
onto each page via a custom regex + function.
You can also provide patterns for certain urls
that should be ignored from the snippet injection.
name: snippetOptions

description: Add additional HTML rewriting rules.
name: rewriteRules
tunnel

description:
Some features of BrowserSync (such as `xip` & `tunnel`) require an internet connection, but if you're
working offline, you can reduce start-up time by setting this option to `false`
name: online

description:
Decide which URL to open automatically when BrowserSync starts. Defaults to "local" if none set.
Can be true, `local`, `external`, `ui`, `ui-external`, `tunnel` or `false`
name: open
browser

description:
Requires an internet connection - useful for services such as [Typekit](https://typekit.com/)
as it allows you to configure domains such as `*.xip.io` in your kit settings
name: xip
snippet:
// Append '.xip.io' to the hostname. (eg: http://192.168.0.4.xip.io:3002)
xip: true

description: Reload each browser when BrowserSync is restarted.
name: reloadOnRestart
snippet:
// don't auto-reload all browsers following a BrowserSync reload
reloadOnRestart: false

description: The small pop-over notifications in the browser are not always needed/wanted.
name: notify
snippet:
// Don't show any notifications in the browser.
notify: false

name: scrollProportionally
snippet: scrollProportionally: false // Sync viewports to TOP position

name: scrollThrottle
snippet: scrollThrottle: 100 // only send scroll events every 100 milliseconds

description:
Time, in milliseconds, to wait before
instruction browser to reload/inject following a
file change event
name: reloadDelay
snippet:
// Wait for 2 seconds before any browsers should try to inject/reload a file.
reloadDelay: 2000

description:
Restrict the frequency in which browser:reload events
can be emitted to connected clients
name: reloadDebounce
snippet:
// Wait 2 seconds after a reload event before allowing more.
reloadDebounce: 2000

description: User provided plugins
name: plugins
injectChanges
startPath
snippet:
// Open the first browser window at URL + "/info.php"
startPath: "/info.php"

description: Whether to minify client script, or not.
name: minify
snippet:
// Don't minify the client-side JS
minify: false

name: host
snippet:
// Override host detection if you know the correct IP to use
host: "192.168.1.1"

name: codeSync
snippet:
// Don't send any file-change events to browsers
codeSync: true,

name: timestamps
snippet:
// Don't append timestamps to injected files
timestamps: false

description:
Alter the script path for complete control over where the BrowserSync
Javascript is served from. Whatever you return from this function
will be used as the script path.
name: scriptPath

description: Configure the Socket.IO path and namespace to avoid collisions. Note: `namespace` can also be a function
name: socket
